markdown: PHILIP MORRIS U. S. A. INTER-OFFICE CORRESPONDENCE Richmond, Virginia To: Mr. J. L. Myracle From: R. P. Heretick Date: June 7, 1990 Subject: CIGT. DEV. - WEEKLY PROJECT STATUS - JUNE 1-7, 1990 **DOMESTIC PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT** C90-03023 # ART Additional product was requested by Market Research for ad pack tests using Tampa test market products (Brand Codes #2280, #2300, #2290, and #2310). The additional quantities requested should be available for shipment the week of June 11, 1990. The remaining ad pack tests were cancelled. Cancelled tests include the following: Next Non-menthol KS/100's (dark blue pack), Merit Non-menthol KS/100's (Spokane pack), Merit Non-menthol KS/100's (new pack), Benson & Hedges Non-menthol/Menthol, KS/100's. A factory trial to develop cigarette specifications for a 9mg tar product packed in 83mm FTB and 100mm FTB is planned for the week of June 11, 1990. Both menthol and non- menthol prototypes will be produced. Results of monadic testing for POL 0701 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 without casing/aftercut), POL 0702 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 with casing 8611-100-1), and POL 0703 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 with MGC aftercut 8776-92) indicated that "there were no significant differences between any of the 3 models tested by the total panel on any of the scales tested (acceptability, strength, and purchase intent)." Summaries of test results for POL 0704 (Art 85mm, casing 8611-100-1 and aftercut 8776-92), POL 0705 and POL 0706 (Art 85mm, casing 8611-100-1 and aftercut 8842-2) will be completed by PED. ## Half-Nic Line Extension Merit Half Nic 85mm prototypes (Blend #232) were produced on June 4, 1990. A revised blend, #242, has been recommended by the Leaf Department and is scheduled to be extracted in the pilot plant and processed in the Semiworks Primary the week of June 11, 1990. <::attestation: Official number stamp Readable Text: 2022155851 A black, vertically oriented string of numbers, likely a stamp, positioned centrally.::> Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/khxj0037

chunks.markdown: PHILIP MORRIS U. S. A. INTER-OFFICE CORRESPONDENCE
To: Mr. J. L. Myracle From: R. P. Heretick
Subject: CIGT. DEV. - WEEKLY PROJECT STATUS - JUNE 1-7, 1990

# ART Additional product was requested by Market Research for ad pack tests using Tampa test market products (Brand Codes #2280, #2300, #2290, and #2310). The additional quantities requested should be available for shipment the week of June 11, 1990. The remaining ad pack tests were cancelled. Cancelled tests include the following: Next Non-menthol KS/100's (dark blue pack), Merit Non-menthol KS/100's (Spokane pack), Merit Non-menthol KS/100's (new pack), Benson & Hedges Non-menthol/Menthol, KS/100's.

A factory trial to develop cigarette specifications for a 9mg tar product packed in 83mm FTB and 100mm FTB is planned for the week of June 11, 1990. Both menthol and non- menthol prototypes will be produced.

Results of monadic testing for POL 0701 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 without casing/aftercut), POL 0702 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 with casing 8611-100-1), and POL 0703 (Art 85mm, Blend #215 with MGC aftercut 8776-92) indicated that "there were no significant differences between any of the 3 models tested by the total panel on any of the scales tested (acceptability, strength, and purchase intent)." Summaries of test results for POL 0704 (Art 85mm, casing 8611-100-1 and aftercut 8776-92), POL 0705 and POL 0706 (Art 85mm, casing 8611-100-1 and aftercut 8842-2) will be completed by PED.

## Half-Nic Line Extension Merit Half Nic 85mm prototypes (Blend #232) were produced on June 4, 1990. A revised blend, #242, has been recommended by the Leaf Department and is scheduled to be extracted in the pilot plant and processed in the Semiworks Primary the week of June 11, 1990.
<::attestation: Official number stamp Readable Text: 2022155851 A black, vertically oriented string of numbers, likely a stamp, positioned centrally.::>
